intro: Bulbostylis densa, commonly known as the dense-styled sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes that bloom in the summer months. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and spikelets that are densely packed, giving it its common name. Bulbostylis densa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in wetland habitats.
